@veritysmart @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency Or perhaps farmers aren't all as cruel and uncaring as you've been led to believe...

How many face coverings did you see littered on your last beach walk?

Litter spoils the places we enjoy and can make its way into the sea and possibly harm marine life.

Bring a bag for your #litter when you go outdoors and take it home to dispose of.

#BinIt4Beaches https://t.co/5XocwdLO82

tweets.text: Very strong smell of slurry coming from the river in the middle of town today. #Frome Reported to the @EnvAgencySW . So long as there is slurry being produced and poured onto land rivers don't have a friggin chance. @RiverActionUK @GeorgeMonbiot @rivercide_live https://t.co/8EVFfOova3

The 1st picture was taken on 16October2019 along the #SilkStream next to the bridge where the stream  enters #SilkstreamPark The litter was reported back then&many times since, but comparing it with the 2nd picture,taken last Sunday,it has still not been cleared,why?@EnvAgencySE https://t.co/RIvTug4ksY

Bearing in mind that the 30-minute peak in the previous monitoring exercise was 44.5, it’s clear my constituents are being subjected to a major and ongoing environmental incident.

I trust the culprits will be properly held accountable by @EnvAgencyMids.

@AaronBell4NUL @EnvAgencyMids What effect are these gasses having on workers here? What are the @healthandsafety regs? Are the daily exposure limits being exceeded? Perhaps this is a way forward, it is a criminal offence under the Health&safetyAtWorkAct to endanger life in the workplace. @RedIndustries2

urls.title: Make your Easter Plastic Free! - Preventing Plastic Pollution

tweets.text:
Happy Easter from all of us at Preventing Plastic Pollution. Thanks to @EnvAgency for this lovely poster! Here are a few simple things you can do this bank holiday weekend to help us tackle plastic pollution: https://t.co/nOhTvzaOoO 

🇬🇧🐣#plasticfree #getcreative 🐣🇪🇺 https://t.co/AOfIzW3ojV

tweets.text:
@DefraGovUK You need to enforce too!! 

Get ALL those rivers & streams actively monitored 24/7 using advanced electronic monitoring. 

Too many farmers AND water companies being let off the hook. 

#PolluterPays #CleanRivers

@IronbridgeAAC @lucyallan @EnvAgency I’m trying to sort this. There isn’t a 6 week closure as far as I’m aware. As I’ve said the EA have requested to carry out ground investigations and want to discuss that with businesses to mitigate impact. No idea why this sign has gone up.

tweets.text:
202 micrograms/cubic metre averaged over 24 hours is an astonishing level of odour. I imagine the notorious and unrecorded weekend of 27th Feb was even higher.

I am grateful to @PHE_uk for their guidance on physical health but this taking its toll on people’s mental health too. https://t.co/OOWEmwoMGp
@fryleigh1974 @SafeSpaceDrWho @EnvAgencySE Don't pretend it's only kids doing this. Plenty of adults are dropping litter everywhere too.
@CarolynHealy @lucyallan @EnvAgency . I make that 6 weeks actually 😡

tweets.text: @johncurtinEA @EnvAgency That takes me back! Fortunately, I can't find one of me from the same era!

@dharford79 @jeanettegriggs Dammit - saw a load of your guys today ok my travels up north on M6 - I’d say about 10 different patrols - the disco’s look smart - mind you it may have been the same 5 on way up and back down lol

And now we know why government have been so busy over the last couple of days.

In 2019 water companies spent over 3,100,000 hours, on over 400,000 occasions dumping sh*t into our rivers and seas.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?

https://t.co/sUsBYs5msz

@DurhamCoast @DurhamCouncil @SunderlandUK @NaturalEngland @durhamwt @HeritageFundNOR @nationaltrust @NorthumbrianH2O @EnvAgencyYNE @GWKNE @HpoolCouncil @CoastalCA @LGACoastalSIG Would love to see a series of before and after photos with sliders (a bit like this). So much change has taken place for the better! 
https://t.co/EfUm7SHHyi

https://t.co/PGN8Ix0xd5 @SMEResilienceUK 
#floodresilience #insurance

tweets.text: @MariaHerlihyEA @EnvAgencySE Fantastic job ! Ops and Waterways are great at thinking outside of the box !

@EnvAgency 25 years old, what a legacy.

“England’s rivers have become nothing more than an extension of the sewage system, polluted, poisoned and exploited for profit." https://t.co/NYtYA46c3g

Works have started on the 1st step of Phase 2 of the #Earby Flood Alleviation Scheme. The works will reduce flood risk from Victoria Clough with the construction of a flood embankment, which will store flood water upstream of Earby. Work is expected to finish by mid-April. #FCERM https://t.co/LcFKvCif2z
@physiobex Hi, the river Douglas is classed as a main river that we regulate. Please can you provide more information regarding your enquiry. Kind regards Shelley

Boaters update:Culham lock 
Our Operations Management and Waterways department have explored all options and have found a temporary solution We are therefore pleased to announce that the lock will be open for navigation for the Easter Bank Holiday weekend.⁦@EnvAgencySE⁩ https://t.co/a1TKArxnvD

@elverdave @BierbergThomas @SEGandrewK It’s a good thing that they are moved past barriers in the Uk. Surely there are reasons why eels are scarce elsewhere?
If there are no elvermen next year (can’t see that happening though)it will be interesting to hear the policy the @EnvAgency has for future eel survival.

@EnvAgencyMids Why is @ClareDinnisEA liking such useless report, landfill will never be odour free so why the hell did you allow it yards from 1000s of homes, why are Persimmon homes building yards from edge , more misery for fools who buy at the hamptons, the landfill is done, it's a mountain,

urls.description: Staffordshire County Council's Director of Care and Health has spoken on the possibility of health issues connected to odours in the west of Newcastle and further afield.

tweets.text: Statement from @StaffordshireCC Director of Care and Health on implications of odours in west Newcastle and further afield.  https://t.co/GLJNln8sQm  @EnvAgencyMids @NewsNBC @PHE_WestMids https://t.co/jjil0Zeulc

@EnvAgency Except we live on the river, so you’re not preventing sewage around people’s homes, you’re just shifting the problem. How would you feel if I dumped raw sewage on your doorstep? If that’s not ok, why is it acceptable for your to dump it on our doorstep?

M6 J12 to J13 a eagle eyed @HighwaysWMIDS who was monitoring the CCTV cameras notice the occupants of a Passat dumping rubbish in a ERA bay.  We intercepted the vehicle M6 J14 to J15 and escorted them back clear their rubbish up.  Details passed to @EnvAgency. 5419 https://t.co/5tWwYYiaDZ
